Class EmoteStealer

A module for stealing emotes and stickers from messages and adding them to the server.

EmoteStealer(IHttpClientFactory, BotConfigService)

A module for stealing emotes and stickers from messages and adding them to the server.

Parameters
Type Name Description
IHttpClientFactory httpFactory
BotConfigService config

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

Steal(IMessage)

Steals emotes from a message and adds them to the server's emote collection.

Declaration
[MessageCommand("Steal Emotes")]
[RequireBotPermission(GuildPermission.ManageEmojisAndStickers)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.ManageEmojisAndStickers)]
public Task Steal(IMessage message)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IMessage message

The message containing emotes to be stolen.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This command requires the "Manage Emojis and Stickers" permission. It goes through all the emotes in the specified message, downloads them, and attempts to add them to the guild. Errors are logged, and a summary of successful and failed additions is provided.

| Edit this page View Source

StealSticker(IMessage)

Steals stickers from a message and adds them to the server's sticker collection.

Declaration
[MessageCommand("Steal Sticker")]
[RequireBotPermission(GuildPermission.ManageEmojisAndStickers)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.ManageEmojisAndStickers)]
public Task StealSticker(IMessage message)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IMessage message

The message containing stickers to be stolen.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Similar to the emote stealing function, this command requires "Manage Emojis and Stickers" permission. It processes all the stickers in the provided message, attempting to add each to the server. Successes and failures are reported, with errors logged for troubleshooting.

Implements

Discord.Interactions.IInteractionModuleBase

Extension Methods

Extensions.ThrowIfNull<T>(T, string)
